intro: Arjona chubutensis, commonly known as the Chubut arjona, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Argentina. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it blooms during the warmer months of the year. Arjona chubutensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various insects and small animals.
